org.activebpel.rt.bpel
Interface IAeBusinessProcessEngine

All Known Subinterfaces:
IAeBusinessProcessEngineInternal, IAeRecoveryEngine
All Known Implementing Classes:
AeBusinessProcessEngine, AeRecoveryEngine
public interface IAeBusinessProcessEngine

Describes the interface used for interacting with a business process engine

Field Summary
static int MONITOR_ERROR
          Monitor status indicating engine is running with one or more error warnings

static int MONITOR_WARNING

retryActivity

public void retryActivity(long aPid,
                          java.lang.String aLocation,
                          boolean aAtScope)
                   throws AeBusinessProcessException
Step resumes the business process identified by the passed pid. The activity identified by the location arg (or its enclosing scope) will be re-executed.

Parameters:
aPid - The process id of the process to resume.
aLocation - A location path for a suspended bpel object.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

completeActivity

public void completeActivity(long aPid,
                             java.lang.String aLocation)
                      throws AeBusinessProcessException
Step resumes the business process identified by the passed pid. The activity identified by the location arg (or its enclosing scope) will be treated as if it had completed normally. It is up to the use to ensure that the process is a "good state" before executing this method.

Parameters:
aPid -
aLocation -
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

queueReceiveData

public long queueReceiveData(IAeProcessPlan aProcessPlan,
                             IAeMessageData aMessageData,
                             IAeReplyReceiver aReply,
                             IAeMessageContext aContext)
                      throws AeBusinessProcessException
Accepts an inbound message which will either create a new process instance or get dispatched to an existing message receiver from an already executing process. If a new process is created, it will be queued for execution.

Parameters:
aProcessPlan -
aMessageData -
aReply -
aContext -
Returns:
the PID the receive was routed to
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

queueReceiveData

public long queueReceiveData(AeInboundReceive aInboundReceive,
                             IAeMessageAcknowledgeCallback aAckCallback,
                             boolean aQueueForExecution)
                      throws AeCorrelationViolationException,
                             AeConflictingRequestException,
                             AeBusinessProcessException
Accepts an inbound message which will either create a new process instance or get dispatched to an existing message receiver from an already executing process. If a new process was created, then this method returns the newly created process id otherwise, returns IAeBusinessProcess.NULL_PROCESS_ID. If the aQueueForExecution was false, then the newly created process is not queued for execution.

Parameters:
aInboundReceive -
aAckCallback - message acknowledgement callback.
aQueueForExecution - if true and if a process was created, the process is queued for execution.
Returns:
If a process was created, then the process id is returned, else returns IAeBusinessProcess.NULL_PROCESS_ID.
Throws:
AeCorrelationViolationException
AeConflictingRequestException
AeBusinessProcessException

queueReceiveData

public IAeWebServiceResponse queueReceiveData(IAeMessageContext aContext,
                                              IAeWebServiceMessageData aData)
                                       throws AeBusinessProcessException,
                                              AeTimeoutException
Primary interface for dispatching messages from web services.

Parameters:
aContext - Provides contextual information about what process and operation are being targeted.
aData - The data for the operation being invoked
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
AeTimeoutException

queueReceiveData

public IAeWebServiceResponse queueReceiveData(IAeMessageContext aContext,
                                              org.w3c.dom.Document[] aDataArray)
                                       throws AeBusinessProcessException,
                                              AeTimeoutException
Specialized doc-literal invocation method for the engine. At a minimum, the user must pass a context that contains the service name for the invoke and the engine will determine the process, partnerlink, and operation by using the data to find the matching signature for the port type.

Parameters:
aContext - Provides contextual information about what process and operation are being targeted.
aDataArray - The data for the operation being invoked
Throws:
AeTimeoutException
AeBusinessProcessException

queueInvokeData

public void queueInvokeData(long aProcessId,
                            java.lang.String aLocationPath,
                            long aTransmissionId,
                            IAeMessageData aMessageData,
                            java.util.Map aProcessProperties)
                     throws AeBusinessProcessException
Allows an externally invoked operation data to dispatch to a queued invoke.

Parameters:
aProcessId - The id of the process expecting the response from the invoke
aLocationPath - The path to the location awaiting the response
aTransmissionId - invoke activity's transmission id.
aMessageData - The data we have received from invoke.
aProcessProperties - Any string name/value pairs we received back from the invoke.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException - Thrown if error occurs setting the receiver.

queueInvokeData

public void queueInvokeData(long aProcessId,
                            java.lang.String aLocationPath,
                            long aTransmissionId,
                            IAeMessageData aMessageData,
                            java.util.Map aProcessProperties,
                            IAeMessageAcknowledgeCallback aAckCallback)
                     throws AeBusinessProcessException
Allows an externally invoked operation data to dispatch to a queued invoke.

Parameters:
aProcessId - The id of the process expecting the response from the invoke
aLocationPath - The path to the location awaiting the response
aTransmissionId - invoke activity's transmission id.
aMessageData - The data we have received from invoke.
aProcessProperties - Any string name/value pairs we received back from the invoke.
aAckCallback - optional callback to acknowledge the receipt of data.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException - Thrown if error occurs setting the receiver.

queueInvokeFault

public void queueInvokeFault(long aProcessId,
                             java.lang.String aLocationPath,
                             long aTransmissionId,
                             IAeFault aFault,
                             java.util.Map aProcessProperties)
                      throws AeBusinessProcessException
Allows an externally invoked operation fault to dispatch to a queued invoke.

Parameters:
aProcessId - The process that's expecting the invoke response
aLocationPath - The path to the location awaiting the response
aTransmissionId - invoke activity's transmission id.
aFault - The fault we received from invoke.
aProcessProperties - Any string name/value pairs we received back from the invoke.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException - Thrown if error occurs setting the receiver.

queueInvokeFault

public void queueInvokeFault(long aProcessId,
                             java.lang.String aLocationPath,
                             long aTransmissionId,
                             IAeFault aFault,
                             java.util.Map aProcessProperties,
                             IAeMessageAcknowledgeCallback aAckCallback)
                      throws AeBusinessProcessException
Allows an externally invoked operation fault to dispatch to a queued invoke.

Parameters:
aProcessId - The process that's expecting the invoke response
aLocationPath - The path to the location awaiting the response
aTransmissionId - invoke activity's transmission id.
aFault - The fault we received from invoke.
aProcessProperties - Any string name/value pairs we received back from the invoke.
aAckCallback - optional callback to acknowledge the receipt of data.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException - Thrown if error occurs setting the receiver.
